heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike ever noted was on 13 May 2025, at 4.97 miles distance.

storm.status: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 17 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (200°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.7°C) and outside temperature (down 2.3°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 4728 lux) and cloud levels (up 174 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.2 mm) and cloud levels (up 474 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 173.9m lower than yesterday, 142.3m higher than the past week, 474.2m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 702m minimum and 2980m maximum, with an average of 1423.8m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1281.5m and 1898.0m.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, the air will feel wet and humid and very little to no wind will be present. Chance of light rain, occasional overcast conditions, and bright intervals likely. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
